summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and Dan Besselsen of Interlochen Center for the Arts. The discussion concerns travel arrangements for a witness and the request for admissions files for students referenced as GX 742 and GX 743, likely in relation to grand jury proceedings.

persons.name: Dan Besselsen
persons.role: Assistant Vice President of Finance, Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Correspondent providing student admissions files (GX 742, 743) and coordinating travel as a potential witness for the prosecution.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Prosecutor, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Government attorney requesting student admissions files and coordinating travel arrangements for Dan Besselsen as a witness.

connections.description: Prosecutor is coordinating travel and requesting documents from Besselsen, who is providing student records and acting as a witness.

events.title: Travel Coordination Request
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney requests Dan Besselsen's personal information (name, DOB, address, phone) for travel arrangements to appear as a witness.

events.title: Request for Student Admissions Files
events.description: Follow-up request for the full admissions files for students referenced as GX 742 and GX 743, beyond the initial summer camp application.

keyFacts: The prosecution is seeking full admissions files for students identified as GX 742 and GX 743 from Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Dan Besselsen is being coordinated as a witness, with the government arranging his travel.
The document references grand jury exhibit numbers (GX 742, 743), indicating these student records are part of grand jury proceedings.
The email chain shows ongoing investigation activities as late as November 2021.
